intro: Phaeanthus cumingii, commonly known as the Cuming's phaeanthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, meaning it can be found growing on trees or rocks in humid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange with intricate patterns, and it blooms during the rainy season. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
